intro: Oyedaea neei, commonly known as the African violet, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Gesneriaceae and is characterized by its dense, velvety foliage and showy, tubular flowers. The plant typically grows as a perennial shrub, reaching heights of up to 30 centimeters. Its leaves are usually heart-shaped and covered in a fine layer of white wax, which helps reduce water loss. Oyedaea neei is popular as a houseplant due to its ornamental value and relatively easy care requirements.
